title.narrative: WTO Trade Facilitation National Needs Assessment

description.narrative: The World Trade Organization (WTO) Trade Facilitation National Needs Assessment initiative will assist developing countries WTO members and observers that designate themselves as small, low income, economies in transition, to conduct a self-assessment of needs and priorities in order to meet commitments under the current WTO Doha round of negotiations on trade facilitation with its key objective to lower trade barriers around the world to help facilitate the increase of global trade. This funding will be used to update the trade facilitation needs assessments completed in 2007-2010, including identifying the technical assistance and capacity building required by developing countries to implement the WTO's Draft Consolidated Negotiating Text. The total value of this initiative is $0.4 million over the 2012-13 financial year.
